intro: Sebastiania brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive red, berry-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
